tourName: Barichara and the Caribbean tailor made holiday in Colombia
generalInfo:
Your 10-day adventure through Colombia will be an unforgettable experience, filled with stunning landscapes, rich history, and vibrant culture. The journey starts in Bucaramanga, a city known for its lush green hills and delicious local cuisine. From there, you'll be transferred to Barichara through the National Park Chicamocha, where you'll get to see the breathtaking views of the Andes mountains.

Once you arrive in Barichara, you'll be immersed in the town's authentic colonial architecture, picturesque streets, and vibrant local culture. The town is known for its handmade crafts, local gastronomy, and stunning views of the Suarez River Canyon. During your stay in Barichara, you'll get to experience the town's warm hospitality, relax in its peaceful ambiance, and indulge in its culinary delights.

Next, you'll head to Santa Marta, a charming town situated on the Caribbean coast. Here, you'll visit the nearby town of Minca, known for its rich biodiversity, stunning waterfalls, and coffee plantations. You'll also get to experience the natural beauty of Cabo San Juan a beautiful and secluded beach located in the heart of the Tayrona National Natural Park. The beach is known for its crystal-clear waters, pristine white sands, and stunning natural surroundings, and Taironaka where you'll have the opportunity to explore the ancient ruins of the Tairona civilization, which dates back to over 1,000 years. The site is located along the banks of the Don Diego River, and you can choose to go down the river by tubing, paddle, or taking a boat ride. As you make your way down the river, you'll pass through lush tropical forests and stunning landscapes, where you'll see a wide variety of wildlife and birds. It's a unique experience that allows you to appreciate the natural beauty of Colombia in a whole new way.

Then, you'll continue your journey to Cartagena, a vibrant city steeped in history, culture, and tradition. You'll walk through the colorful streets of the Old Town, a UNESCO World Heritage site, and visit the city's most iconic landmarks, such as the San Felipe Castle and the Cartagena Cathedral. You'll also get to enjoy the city's bustling nightlife and savor its exquisite cuisine.

You'll visit the Bazurto Market in Cartagena, where you'll discover a vibrant and colorful world of exotic fruits, vegetables, seafood, and meats. This bustling market is a true feast for the senses, and you'll have the chance to try some of the local specialties and interact with friendly vendors.

Finally, you'll head to the stunning Rosario Islands, a group of small coral islands located off the coast of Cartagena. Here, you'll have the chance to relax on the beautiful beaches, swim in crystal-clear waters, and explore the surrounding coral reefs.

dayInfo.description: Arrival Bucaramanga: Arrive at any time to be collected from the airport and taken directly on to your tour to Barichara. we offer a much better option to make this transfer a fantastic experience. You'll enjoy a 30-minute ride in the longest cable car in Colombia, with stunning panoramic views and a guided tour of the Chicamocha National Park. After disembarking, you'll enter Panachi and take a walking tour of the Guane Museum and other historical monuments. Then, your private transport will take you to Barichara. (Overnight in Barichara)

Hike through some of the most stunning landscapes in the region, with breathtaking views of the surrounding mountains and valleys. Once you arrive in Guane, you can explore the charming town and learn about its rich history and culture. But that's not all - the real highlight of this excursion is the gastronomical tour in Barichara that awaits you upon your return. For three hours, you'll get to indulge in some of the most delicious local cuisines, from traditional empanadas and arepas to artisanal chocolates. (Overnight in Barichara)

You’ll have a relaxing morning in Barichara before traveling back to Bucaramanga for an afternoon flight to Santa Marta. Once here you’ll be collected and taken directly to your hotel in Santa Marta. (Overnight in Santa Marta)

Explore the charming town of Minca and its cozy cafes and artisan shops. Take a coffee tour to discover the secrets behind Colombia's liquid gold. Learn about the process of making delicious chocolate, and even indulge in a chocolate facemask. Discover hidden waterfalls and take a refreshing swim in the cool waters (remember to bring your swimming trunks). Keep an eye out for exotic birds throughout your mountain adventure in Minca.

You’ll be taken to Tayrona Park and enjoy a 2-hour ecological walk through the jungle and visit 4 beaches along the way including Arenillas, La Piscina, Cabo San Juan, and Los Arrecifes. You'll also enjoy some fantastic beach time (approx. 3 hours), along with time to explore the area or partake in some watersports, such as snorkeling. After your beach time has passed you'll enjoy a 1.3-hour walk through the jungle and your waiting transportation. During your ecological walks, you will learn about the local environment and the local indigenous. You'll learn about what native animals can be seen and or hear. Your guide will also be safeguarding your possessions while you're relaxing in the temperate waters and taking as many photos as you may need. (Overnight Santa Marta)

Collected from your Santa Marta hotel at 8 am, you’ll venture into the Sierra Nevada jungle, driving for approximately 1.5 hours to the entrance of Rio Don Diego. From there, you’ll take a 15-minute boat ride up the river to Tayronaka, an ancient archaeological site surrounded by stunning natural beauty. You’ll explore the ruins and artifacts with your guide, who will answer any questions you have about the history of the location. Then, you'll visit the nearby Kogui community, where you'll meet some of the direct descendants of the Tayrona people. After enjoying a typical lunch, you'll have the option to kayak, paddleboard, or float back down the river to the Caribbean Sea. Here, you can relax on the beach and witness a beautiful sunset before returning to your hotel. It's another day in paradise in Colombia. (Overnight Santa Marta)

Relax in a morning drive along the coast to your waiting hotel in Cartagena. Once here you’ll check into your hotel and enjoy some Free Time before your 4pm city tour. You'll explore the charming colonial streets, plazas, restaurants, cafes, and bars within the walled city, along with one of the oldest and most bohemian neighborhoods in Cartagena. Visit the iconic landmarks such as the Clock Tower monument, Bolivar Park, Plaza Saint Pedro Claver, Plaza de Los Jagüeyes, San Diego, and the colorful streets of Gertsemani while learning about the city's historic struggle between the Spanish colonialists and pirates from different nations. (Overnight Cartagena)

Enjoy a wonderful ocean cruise on a speedboat to the Rosario Islands; arriving at a beautiful picturesque beach for a typical Caribbean lunch, crystal clear waters, water-sports, white sands, and palm trees. You'll be assigned your personal beach space which will be exclusive for yourself and members of your group.

Explore the colorful neighborhood of Getsemani and its hip cafes, bars, and restaurants with a bilingual guide. Visit Centenario Park and Holy Trinity Square, and discover the hidden gems of this vibrant area. Then, head to the Bazurto markets to learn about daily life and sample exotic fruits and meats, followed by an authentic lunch at Celia's restaurant. Finish off with a stroll through the artisan and community area and a refreshing freshly made juice of your choice. At 4:30 you'll have the best closure for your trip; a sunset Catamaran Cruise(Overnight Cartagena)
Hablamos pronto, safe travels home, and visit again soon! We’ll have transport waiting to take you to the airport at your desired time.
